children.subject: In the case people have to plan alternatively, I would like to point out that 189 is currently slotted to be offered in the summer, based on the course catalog.

history.content:
CS 189 has significantly less seats this spring compared to previous spring, 557 vs 600-700+. Not to mention, the 557 seats is effectively only 503 seats due to 54 of those being permanently reserved for DS majors and does not expire even when Adjustment Period start. Compared to that, 493 CS majors reserved seats would expire when Adjustment starts. Coupled with the fact that the majority of 189 students dropped after Adjustment means we would have significantly lowered chance of getting off the waitlist.

According to @13513_f115, the 493 reserved seats for CS/EECS majors are not similarly extended into Adjustment period because Enrollment does not have time capacity and would have to wait until summer. However, DS Enrollment did extend the time to guarantee their students permanent reserved seats in another department, our department. Can CS Enrollment also spend the time to ensure that its own students have a fair chance of getting in to an in-demand CS course that satisfy CS degree requirement? Some of us don't have the luxury to wait until next spring.
history.subject: 189 Reserved Seats for CS Major Should be Extended Into Adjustment Period
